name: soundproof
content:

(of a building or part of a building) not allowing sound to go through: a soundproof room/wall/studio The hotel is fully soundproofed so getting a good night's sleep in such a busy area is easy.
More examplesFewer examplesIn a series of soundproof booths, they sit hunched over telephones.Do we need to alter the doors here to make the room soundproof? In a small soundproofed studio, an instructor is teaching a group of would-be rappers how to operate digital recording equipment.

Related word
soundproofing
to prevent sound from coming into a room or building, or from being heard outside it: Millions of pounds have already have been spent to soundproof homes and schools around the airport. It was a well soundproofed building, so we didn't hear the traffic outside.
More examplesFewer examplesPaul soundproofed his garage and began recording music there.The room was soundproofed so the only thing that kept me awake was the snoring of my son.I wondered whether it might be possible to do something to soundproof the door.
